etymology.description: semantic 口 + phonetic 丂 (OC *kʰluːʔ), with a reference to exhaled air; possibly originally “to sing”; cf. 訶 and 哥 (可 written twice).
etymology.interpretation: Mouth signals the domain of speech or breath, while 丂 supplies the sound and hints at exhalation. The sense likely began with vocalization and later extended to notions of permission or possibility, with related forms preserving the vocal or doubled structure.

examples.chinese: 我们可在这里休息(我們可在這裡休息)。
这个方案还可接受(這個方案還可接受)。
你这建议可行(你這建議可行)。
